New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his career-high 47th homer.
Shohei Ohtani is moving closer to achieving baseball's first 50-50 season with 47 homers and 48 stolen bases.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani sparked a four-homer first inning with a 118.1-mph homer.
Tommy Edman hit two homers, one from each side of the plate, in the first and eighth innings.
The Dodgers hit back-to-back-to-back homers in the first inning by Edman, Will Smith, and Max Muncy.
Ohtani walked and stole his 48th base in the second inning.
Ohtani hit a two-out, two-run single in the third inning.
Cody Bellinger hit a three-run homer for the Cubs in the fifth inning.
Gavin Lux hit a clutch, two-out RBI single in the seventh inning.
Tommy Edman hit his second homer of the game in the eighth inning.
Michael Kopech walked the first three batters in the ninth inning but managed to close the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts commented on the team's energy and fight during the game.
Roberts discussed Shohei Ohtani's potential to win the NL MVP award and his unprecedented season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers avoided a three-game sweep and pushed their National League West lead to five games over Arizona and 5½ over San Diego.
The Dodgers reduced their magic number to clinch the division title to 12 with 16 games to play.
